name: PUMA Unisex's Purecat Slide Sandal
review: Hi. Just wanted to give quick impression on these flip flops.First of all the size. I put up photos that hopfully will help someone. I take exactly a size UK 8, but with these i took other reviewers advice and ordered a size Uk 9 (one size up from my norm)  I found that, if you look close at the photos, there is an indent/impression of a foot shape with toe grooves on the inside sole of the shoe. I found this part (the whole length of indent)  from indent heal to indent toe on the size 9 shoe, to be exactly a size UK 8, which leaves about half an inch front and back bettween my foot and the ends of shoe. Which is perfect. So if i had bought my normal size (size UK8) it would have been to small my foot would have been right up to both ends, whith no spare room. So i would recommend if you know your exact size, order a size up from that. ( sorry if this is all a bit confusing, lol, but its quite hard to explain/ Photos show it better)As for the shoe itself, for 12 pounds, i feel is an ok price for what they are. I only bought mine to use at the swimming pool, for use going to and from changing rooms, and for that purpose they are just fine. I do wear them around the house a little, but for me i wouldnt wear them full time, as i have quite wide feet and  find them a little tight on the band area. But this could just be because they are new im sure they will loosen over time, and it is not tight as in hurting, just a bit to much pressure for my liking, but i do have a touch arthritis in my toes, so that why the slight pressure bothers me. The soles are firm but soft enough, not squishy, i wouldnt want to walk any great distance in them, but they are not uncomfortable either.Overall, for the price they are just fine nothing special and nothing bad. For what i bought them for (use at swimming pool and popping in and out to the garden etc they are just fine and i wouldnt recommend them For wearing all day and using as your main footwear, in that scenario i would maybe spend more and get something more padded and comfy.As for longevity i cant say as yet, as i only had them a week, but they seem sturdy and well enough made.Anyways, hope this helps someone and any further questions feel free to ask.UPDATE: Just been using them for over a week. I originally said that i personally found them a little tight over the toes/foot, but i take that back now, they have loosend a little and top strap has molded to the shape of my foot. so all is good. no pressure on the top of my foot and they are nice and comfy :)All the best, Take care and stay safe. G :)

review: Adidas slider sandals: "Adilette Aqua" FY8047; SIZE 9UK &US; FR 43; JP 275; CHN 265. Made in Vietnam. New, original, in sealed bag with QR & BAR CODES factory stickers, & ADIDAS Hanger. Sold & delivered by Amazon UK, at a welcome discount. The Mrs & I have had items, such as clothes, (and even a 2016 MICROSOFT 640XL, which still works well for calls & SMS, and calculations) made in Vietnam; and found their quality control high. * A light blue, with white stripes across the instep, which, I realised would suit a neighbour, as they match his Fiat 500 - so I really should show them to him! There is enclosed a long list, on a small card, of 21 activities, which the sandals are suitable for - including walking, cycling, golf, & swimming - but not for bobsleighing, before anyone asks! These are of a strong build quality, & a good fit across the instep; & leave a generous gap of around 3cm, front & rear, which I require as a buffer zone for my toes & heals (my normal size is UK 9.) CONCLUSION: Recommended on quality for the price. If, like myself, you can be a bit clumsy, with a long history of broken crockery and glasses; and I  never want to walk again into an abandoned wooden pallet - in flip flops, - I also recommend your choosing your usual shoe size, as a generous fit, or one size up! ❗ UPDATE: mid-July 2023. I have sunk into the sole of the sandals, as per the shape of my feet. I recently saw a young man  in a park in Nike sliders, who had sunk further into his, than I; likely, he paid a lot more for his! *In comparison, the chunky Mrs has not sunk into her genuine CROCS (See my Review.) They were on offer; and I ordered a pair of unattractive White ones, on price, and minus the badge, but they were waaaay too big, even with socks on. So, I recommend the CROCS, if on offer, and if you order one size up, which worked for her. If on a firm budget, seems only the company name is the difference with the competition. The Mrs is very pleased with her CROCS, so, then, I am not subject to her kicking them off in my direction!
